page.title: 19Ecology.
page.content: A study of the Mytton Dingle showed the following land-cover observations: At{255m}above sea-level the main land- cover was fern, grass and broom. At{265m}it was still fern and broom but the grass was much finer and more wind-resistant. At{275m}it was broom fern and gorse and the occasional tree. At{300m}heather was predominant with occasional very stunted gorse bushes and some fern in sheltered hollows. At {350m}it was about 70% heather and 25% whimberry. Unusual wild flowers seen in the area include{sheep's bit, navelwort, white {foxgloves, birdsfoot trefoil, cowslip and{butterfly orchid. Mammals sighted locally include{foxes, {badgers, weasels}and{pine martens. Birds seen locally include{buzzards, {grouse, little owls}and{kestrels.
